Posts.Content: Thank you both!!! Still a bit shocked. Another appt on 1-20-14 for questions & plan. Working on a question list now. I also added some info to my signature. Thanks again!

Posts.Title: Newbie, prostate cancer diagnosis after a health fair blood test

Posts.Content: Within the past couple days, I found out I have prostate cancer and all my details. Most biopsies are fully involved with high Gleason. Scans were negative but it is an aggressive cancer. I am just looking for others experiences and information. I have read many posts and found them very helpful. Thanks for help! n2hawgs

Posts.Title: Newbie, prostate cancer diagnosis after a health fair blood test

Posts.Content: Thank You, ddayglo I did ask about surgery but was persuaded otherwise. My urologist is a surgeon. He said he would love to do the surgery but did not feel there would be a good outcome in the long run(due to high Gleason scores) I had only 6 cores all contained cancer and 4 were totally involved. So, I am opting for IMRT and hormone therapy. I also asked to have my slides reviewed by another pathologist. I reviewed your posts and really appreciate the detailed information. I would love to have that prostate out but there is a great chance something will be left behind. I'll meet with an oncology radiologist on 1-27-14. Thanks!!!
